meanings.definition: To make a clamor or loud noise.
meanings.sent1: The children were beclamoring in the playground, laughing and shouting.
meanings.sent2: During the storm, the thunder was beclamoring loudly outside.
meanings.sent3: The beclamoring of the pots and pans in the kitchen made it hard to concentrate.
meanings.sent4: The beclamoring wind outside sounded like a wild animal trying to get in.
meanings.sent5: The beclamoring of the crowd at the concert was deafening.

meanings.definition: To shout or demand loudly and insistently.
meanings.sent1: The fans beclamoring for their favorite singer to come on stage.
meanings.sent2: The protesters were beclamoring for justice outside the courthouse.
meanings.sent3: The beclamoring of the children for ice cream could be heard from the other room.
meanings.sent4: She beclamored for attention from her busy parents.
meanings.sent5: The politician beclamored for change during his speech.
